name: Duty-Bound Dead
text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{3}{B}: Regenerate Duty-Bound Dead. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Dwarven Armorer
text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a +0/+1 counter or a +1/+0 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor:
"The few remaining pieces from this period suggest the Dwarves eventually made weapons and armor out of everything, even children's toys."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

name: Dwarven Armory
text: {2}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +2/+2 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only during any upkeep step.

editions.flavor:
"Few of us left, now. Confounded Yeti have opened all the vents. We'd best hide here with the weapons."
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

name: Dwarven Berserker
text: Whenever Dwarven Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "I may be small, but I can kick your butt."

name: Dwarven Blastminer
text:
{2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
Morph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: "Life is too short for something like a hunk of rock to get in my way."

name: Dwarven Bloodboiler
text: Tap an untapped Dwarf you control: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His battle cry unleashes an avalanche of dwarves.

name: Dwarven Catapult
text: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.

editions.flavor:
"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

"Often greatly outnumbered in battle, Dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

name: Dwarven Demolition Team
text: {T}: Destroy target Wall.

editions.flavor: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

name: Dwarven Driller
text: {T}: Destroy target land unless its controller has Dwarven Driller deal 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"Drill the planet, it's no trouble:
Mining granite, making rubble."
—Dwarven drilling song

name: Dwarven Grunt
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor:
Hard as stone and twice as stubborn.
—Dwarven compliment

name: Dwarven Hold
text:
Dwarven Hold enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Dwarven Hold during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Dwarven Hold is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Dwarven Hold: Add {R} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Dwarven Landslide
text:
Kicker—{2}{R}, Sacrifice a land. (You may pay {2}{R} and sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target land. If Dwarven Landslide was kicked, destroy another target land.

name: Dwarven Lieutenant
text: {1}{R}: Target Dwarf creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Dwarven officers were tireless in battle, moving up and down the lines to rally their troops and boost morale."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

name: Dwarven Miner
text: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.

editions.flavor:
"Fetch the pestridder, Paka—we've got dwarves in the rutabagas!"
—Jamul, Femeref farmer

name: Dwarven Nomad
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
A dwarf's life belongs as much to the land as to the dwarf.
—Creed of the Stonethrow Clan

name: Dwarven Patrol
text:
Dwarven Patrol doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a nonred spell, untap Dwarven Patrol.

editions.flavor: Dwarves never worry about who watches their backs.

name: Dwarven Pony
text: {1}{R}, {T}: Target Dwarf creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor:
"I hear Halina's got a pony that can count to six—and likes to eat meat."
—Chandler

name: Dwarven Recruiter
text: When Dwarven Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Dwarf cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

name: Dwarven Ruins
text:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

name: Dwarven Scorcher
text: Sacrifice Dwarven Scorcher: Dwarven Scorcher deals 1 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Dwarven Scorcher deal 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: Barbarians invented the blaze of glory. Dwarves perfected it.

name: Dwarven Sea Clan
text: {T}: Choose target attacking or blocking creature whose controller controls an Island. Dwarven Sea Clan deals 2 damage to that creature at end of combat. Activate this ability only before the end of combat step.

editions.flavor:
"No dwarf alive can best one of my crew dead."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Dwarven Shrine
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Dwarven Shrine deals X damage to that player, where X is twice the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

name: Dwarven Soldier
text: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Let no one say we did not fight until the last . . . ."
—Headstone fragment from a mass grave found in the Crimson Peaks

"Orc must die / Orc must die / Not an orc? / March on by."
—Dwarven marching song
There is a legend among present-day Dwarves that the Dwarves of Sarpadia will one day return to defend Dwarvenkind against a deadly peril.

"Let no one say we did not fight until the last . . . ."
—Headstone fragment from a mass grave found in the Crimson Peaks

"Although the Dwarves staunchly defended their walled city-states against the Orcs, their civilization was the first to fall, and its name was sadly lost."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

name: Dwarven Song
text: Any number of target creatures become red until end of turn.

name: Dwarven Strike Force
text: Discard a card at random: Dwarven Strike Force gains first strike and haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Any given foothill may hide dozens of dwarves waiting to spill from their tunnels like fire ants.

name: Dwarven Thaumaturgist
text: {T}: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Their definition of ‘fair profit' is certainly novel."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

"They wouldn't sell their own families—at least, not for cheap."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

name: Dwarven Vigilantes
text: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.

name: Dwarven Warriors
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Dwarven Weaponsmith
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Work with zeal as hammers peal! Melt, anneal, and pound the steel!"
—Old Dwarvish forge-chant

name: Dwell on the Past
text: Target player shuffles up to four target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.

editions.flavor:
None can find what hasn't been lost.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen
text:
Reach
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen attacks, you gain 1 life for each attacking Elf you control.

editions.flavor: "This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."
"This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."
"This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."

name: Dwynen's Elite
text: When Dwynen's Elite enters the battlefield, if you control another Elf, create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: "Come, my beautiful brothers and sisters. Let us hunt."—Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf daen

name: Dying Wail
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, target player discards two cards.

editions.flavor: This is a world of spiteful wasps that sting and kill even as they die.

name: Dying Wish
text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature dies, target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is its power.

editions.flavor: "I wish I could rewrite my every deed and kill you with my first breath instead of my last."

name: Dynacharge
text:
Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Overload {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

editions.flavor: Nothing evens the odds like a little lightning.

name: Dynavolt Tower
text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
{T}, Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}: Dynavolt Tower deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"I like that Tezzeret. He has vision the other judges don't. He sees the potential in what we're making here."
—Faiz, inventor

name: Dystopia
text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a green or white permanent.

editions.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."
The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.
"Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."
"Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."
The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

name: Eager Construct
text: When Eager Construct enters the battlefield, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: Loyal to a fault, it anticipates its master's every need.

name: Eagle of the Watch
text: Flying, vigilance

editions.flavor:
"Even from miles away, I could see our eagles circling. That's when I gave the command to pick up the pace. I knew we were needed at home."
—Kanlos, Akroan captain

"Even from miles away, I could see our eagles circling. That's when I knew we were needed at home."
—Kanlos, Akroan captain

name: Early Frost
text: Tap up to three target lands.

editions.flavor: Under its mists, the earth sleeps.

name: Early Harvest
text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

editions.flavor:
"Earth's increase, foison plenty,
Barns and garners never empty:
Vines with clust'ring bunches growing;
Plants with goodly burden bowing."
—William Shakespeare, The Tempest

"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
"Give it a week and it will feed an army."

"Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Earnest Fellowship
text: Each creature has protection from its colors.

editions.flavor:
"The world has enough strife as it is. Where would we be if we turned against each other?"
—Pianna, nomad captain

name: Earsplitting Rats
text:
When Earsplitting Rats enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.
Discard a card: Regenerate Earsplitting Rats.

editions.flavor: Rats come in one amount: too many.

name: Earthbind
text:
Enchant creature
When Earthbind enters the battlefield, if enchanted creature has flying, Earthbind deals 2 damage to that creature and Earthbind gains "Enchanted creature loses flying."

name: Earthblighter
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target land.

editions.flavor: "A single dedicated mind can bring about the greatest destruction. That, or goblins—goblins work too."

name: Earthbrawn
text:
Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Reinforce 1—{1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.)

editions.flavor: Gremil finally felt in touch with nature—and felt a need to share the experience with others.

name: Earthcraft
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.

editions.flavor:
"The land gives up little, but we are masters of persuasion."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Earthlink
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Earthlink unless you pay {2}.
Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.

name: Earthlore
text:
Enchant land you control
Tap enchanted land: Target blocking creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted land is untapped.

editions.flavor:
"Even the ground is our friend."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Earthquake
text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

name: Earth Rift
text:
Destroy target land.

name: Earth Servant
text: Earth Servant gets +0/+1 for each Mountain you control.

editions.flavor:
"Fire. Air. Water. These elements spread, filling in the spaces they are not. But earth is implacable like a sullen child."
—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity

"Fire. Air. Water. These elements spread, filling in the spaces they are not. But earth is implacable like a sullen child."
—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity

name: Earthshaker
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Earthshaker deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

editions.flavor: It scaled the Sokenzan Mountains in search of Kumano's secret. The mountain shook for two days, and the kami never returned.

name: Earth Surge
text: Each land gets +2/+2 as long as it's a creature.

editions.flavor:
"Some gardeners sing to plants. I tell them stories—stories of how they once ruled the world, of the mortals who destroyed their kind, and of revenge."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore

name: Earwig Squad
text:
Prowl {2}{B} (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a Goblin or Rogue.)
When Earwig Squad enters the battlefield, if its prowl cost was paid, search target opponent's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Eastern Paladin
text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.

editions.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—Southern paladin

"Their fragile world. Their futile lives. They obstruct the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall excise them."
—Oath of the East

name: Eaten by Spiders
text: Destroy target creature with flying and all Equipment attached to that creature.

editions.flavor: After sampling many victims, the spider developed a preference for the undead and their accoutrements.

name: Eater of Days
text:
Flying, trample
When Eater of Days enters the battlefield, you skip your next two turns.

editions.flavor: When Mirrodin's varied civilizations developed ways to fight the levelers, Memnarch upped the stakes.

text:
Flying
{B}, Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Eater of Hope.

text:

Flying

editions.flavor:
"The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth."
—Troilus and Cressida, William Shakespeare

text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a spell, you lose 1 life.

editions.flavor: The deadliest killers serve only those who are not afraid to die.

First strike, trample

text:

text: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has seven or more cards in hand, Ebony Owl Netsuke deals 4 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"Owls filled the skies during the Kami War, harbingers of darker times to come."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Ebony Rhino
text: Trample

editions.flavor:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."

—Chandler

name: Ebony Treefolk
text: {B}{G}: Ebony Treefolk gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Its roots are equally happy to drink the water of a clear stream or the oily blood of a Phyrexian warrior.

name: Echo Chamber
text: {4}, {T}: An opponent chooses target creature he or she controls. Put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield. That token gains haste until end of turn. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Echo Circlet
text:
Equipped creature can block an additional creature each combat.
Equip {1}

name: Eerie Interlude
text: Exile any number of target creatures you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: The barrier between existence and oblivion is thinner than you know.
The barrier between existence and oblivion is thinner than you know.

name: Eerie Procession
text: Search your library for an Arcane card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Though in years past speculation was not encouraged about the strange ways of kami, now we must understand their motivations, if such is even possible to the mortal mind."
—Lady Azami

name: Efficient Construction
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: For some of Ghirapur's aerowrights, building thopters is a byproduct of larger construction efforts.

name: Efreet Weaponmaster
text:
First strike
When Efreet Weaponmaster enters the battlefield or is turned face up, another target creature you control gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {2}{U}{R}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Ego Erasure
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Creatures target player controls get -2/-0 and lose all creature types until end of turn.

editions.flavor: When all is taken away, all are equal.

name: Eidolon of Blossoms
text: Constellation — Whenever Eidolon of Blossoms or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The emotional echoes of dryad gatherings attract lost souls.
The emotional echoes of dryad gatherings attract lost souls.

name: Eidolon of Countless Battles
text:
Bestow {2}{W}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Eidolon of Countless Battles and enchanted creature each get +1/+1 for each creature you control and +1/+1 for each Aura you control.
